message.content:
I'll calculate the financial metrics step by step based on the given statements.

## Step 1: Free Cash Flow (FCF)
FCF = Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities - Capital Expenditures
FCF = -1,028,375.55 - 85,889.19 = -1,114,264.74

## Step 2: Return on Assets (ROA)
ROA = Net Income / Average Total Assets
Average Total Assets = (Initial Total Assets + End Total Assets) / 2
Average Total Assets = (13,000,000.00 + 14,214,117.02) / 2 = 13,607,058.51
ROA = 835,266.51 / 13,607,058.51 = 0.0614 = 6.14%

## Step 3: Return on Equity (ROE)
ROE = Net Income / Average Shareholders' Equity
Average Shareholders' Equity = (Initial Equity + End Equity) / 2
Average Shareholders' Equity = (13,000,000.00 + 13,835,266.51) / 2 = 13,417,633.26
ROE = 835,266.51 / 13,417,633.26 = 0.0622 = 6.22%

## Step 4: Operating Cash Flow to Net Income Ratio
Operating Cash Flow to Net Income Ratio = Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities / Net Income
Operating Cash Flow to Net Income Ratio = -1,028,375.55 / 835,266.51 = -1.23

## Step 5: Net Profit Margin
Net Profit Margin = Net Income / Total Revenue
Net Profit Margin = 835,266.51 / 2,637,011.03 = 0.3167 = 31.67%

## Step 6: Gross Profit Margin
Gross Profit Margin = Gross Profit / Total Revenue
Gross Profit Margin = 1,622,011.03 / 2,637,011.03 = 0.6151 = 61.51%
